spirit:field.spirit:description: Feature ID

spirit:field.spirit:description: Feature Revision

spirit:field.spirit:name: dfh_byte_offset
spirit:field.spirit:description: Next DFH Byte Offset Bit [15:0] Next DFH Address = 0x1000 (Current DFH Address + Next DFH Byte Offset Used to figure out Next DFH Address and as an indication for the maximum size of MMIO region occupied by this feature. For last feature, this offset points to the beginning of the unallocated MMIO region, if any (or beyond the end of the MMIOspace).

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_dfh_hi
spirit:register.spirit:description: Device Feature Header Hi

spirit:field.spirit:name: dfh_byte_offset
spirit:field.spirit:description: Next DFH Byte Offset Bit [39:32] Next DFH Address = 0x00 (Current DFH Address + Next DFH Byte Offset Used to figure out Next DFH Address and as an indication for the maximum size of MMIO region occupied by this feature. For last feature, this offset points to the beginning of the unallocated MMIO region, if any (or beyond the end of the MMIO space).

spirit:field.spirit:name: end_of_list
spirit:field.spirit:description:
End of List

1'b0 = This is last feature header (see Next DFH Byte Offset)

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_csr_addr_l
spirit:register.spirit:description: Feature CSR ADDR

spirit:field.spirit:name: feature_csr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Points to where the IP/SS proprietary feature CSRs start. Need to provision space for future std DFH registers to grow For all IP/SS, this field shall point to 0x60

spirit:field.spirit:name: csr_rel
spirit:field.spirit:description: Point to CSR located in a different address space which may be outside of PCI BAR, mainly for ARM 1'b0 = relative (offset from feature DFH start),1'b1 = absolute For all IP/SS, this field shall be 1b0.

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_csr_addr_h
spirit:register.spirit:description: Feature CSR ADDR

spirit:field.spirit:name: feature_csr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Points to where the IP/SS proprietary feature CSRs start. Need to provision space for future std DFH registers to grow For all IP/SS, this field shall point to 0x60

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_csr_size_grp_l
spirit:register.spirit:description: Feature CSR Size Group

spirit:field.spirit:name: has_params
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates whether the optional Param Header and Param Y CSR are present or not. For all IP/SS, this field shall be 1b0 (no Param Header and no Param Y CSR)

spirit:field.spirit:name: grouping_id
spirit:field.spirit:description: Used to group features / interfaces . To differentiate & group different blocks within the pipeline For all IP/SS, this field is driver to zeros.

spirit:field.spirit:name: instance_id
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enumeration of instantiated IP A counter to differentiate each instances of the IP, advertise the instance ID assigned by Quartus To allow software to build the graph. Value derived from DFHv1_INSTID parameter

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_csr_size_grp_h
spirit:register.spirit:description: Feature CSR Size Group

spirit:field.spirit:name: csr_size
spirit:field.spirit:description: Size of CSR block in bytes Specifies the size of the IP/SS proprietary feature CSR in Bytes

spirit:field.spirit:description: Read Command

spirit:field.spirit:name: write_command
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write Command

spirit:field.spirit:name: ack_trans
spirit:field.spirit:description:
ACK_TRANS: Bit gets asserted by hw when transaction is complete. Gets cleared by hw, when hw receives the next command.

0- indicates, a command is getting processed.

1- Indicates, the earlier command processing is complete and it's ready to accept next command.

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_hssi_ctrl_addr
spirit:register.spirit:description: HSSI Control 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: sal_command
spirit:field.spirit:description:
RSAL Command:

0x0 NOP

0x1 get_hssi_profile

0x2 set_hssi_profile

0x3 read_MAC_statistic

0x4 get_mtu

0x5 Set CSR

0x6 Get CSR

0x7 Enable loopback

0x8 Disable loopback

0x9 - 0xFE reserved

0xFF firmware_versionserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: port_addr
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Port/Address:

When SAL command = get_hssi_profile, set_hssi_profile, enable loopback, disable loopback, [11:8] = Port

When SAL command = get_csr, set_csr, [11:8] = Address[3:0]

Others[11:8] = 4'b0

spirit:field.spirit:name: channel_addr
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Channel/Address:

When SAL command = get_hssi_profile, set_hssi_profile, enable loopback, disable loopback, [15:12] = Channel

When SAL command = get_csr, set_csr, [15:12] = Address[7:4]

Others, [15:12] = 4'b0

spirit:field.spirit:name: addr_msb
spirit:field.spirit:description: Address bit [23:8]

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_gmii_xgmii_tx_latency
spirit:register.spirit:description: GMII/XGMII TX Latency

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_latency
spirit:field.spirit:description:
gmii_tx_latency/xgmii_tx_latency The latency of the PHY excluding the PMA block on the TX datapath:

Bits [15:10], [21:10] and [23:10]: The number of clock cycles.

Bits [9:0]: The fractional number of clock cycles.

The width is:

16 bits for 1G/2.5G/10G (MGBASE-T) with IEEE 1588 configurations.

22 bits for 2.5G, 1G/2.5G, 10M/100M/1G/2.5G, 1G/2.5G/10G (MGBASE-T),10M/100M/1G/2.5G/10G(MGBASE-T)

24 bits for 10M/100M/1G/2.5G/5G/10G (USXGMII) configurations.

This signal is available when only the Enable IEEE 1588 Precision Time Protocol parameter is selected. Note: For USXGMII configuration, the latency value may be unstable for the first three transmitted packets times (at least 64 bytes). You should not use the latency value within this period. Only applicable for MRPHY profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rsvd
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reserved

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_gmii_xgmii_rx_latency
spirit:register.spirit:description: GMII/XGMII RX Latency

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_latency
spirit:field.spirit:description:
gmii_rx_latency/xgmii_rx_latency The latency of the PHY excluding the PMA block on the TX datapath:

Bits [15:10], [21:10] and [23:10]: The number of clock cycles.

Bits [9:0]: The fractional number of clock cycles.

The width is:

16 bits for 1G/2.5G/10G (MGBASE-T) with IEEE 1588 configurations.

22 bits for 2.5G, 1G/2.5G, 10M/100M/1G/2.5G, 1G/2.5G/10G (MGBASE-T),10M/100M/1G/2.5G/10G(MGBASE-T)

24 bits for 10M/100M/1G/2.5G/5G/10G (USXGMII) configurations.

This signal is available when only the Enable IEEE 1588 Precision Time Protocol parameter is selected. Note: For USXGMII configuration, the latency value may be unstable for the first three transmitted packets times (at least 64 bytes). You should not use the latency value within this period. Only applicable for MRPHY profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rsvd
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reserved

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_hssi_eth_port0_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: HSSI Ethernet port0 Status (Depends on NUM_PORTS parameter, read returns reserved value 0 if port does not exist)

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_ehip_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip_ready:

The Ethernet channel deasserts this signal in response to an i_csr_rst_n or i_tx_rst_n reset, or either of the corresponding soft resets. After the reset process completes, the channel reasserts this signal to indicate that the Hard IP for Ethernet block has completed initialization and is ready to interoperate with the main Intel Stratix 10 die. While the o_ehip_ready signal is low, the channel's datapath is not ready for data on the client interface nor ready for register accesses on the Ethernet reconfiguration interface.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_rx_hi_ber
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_rx_hi_ber:

Asserted to indicate the RX PCS of the corresponding Ethernet channel is in a HI BER state according to Figure 82-15 in the IEEE 802.3- 2015 Standard. The IP core uses this signal in autonegotiation and link training.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_cdr_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_cdr_lock:

Indicates that the recovered clocks are locked to data. The o_clk_rec_div64[n] and o_clk_rec_div66[n] clocks are reliable only after o_cdr_lock[n] is asserted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_am_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_am_lock:

Asserted when the RX PCS completes detection of alignment markers and deskew of the virtual PCS lanes in the corresponding Ethernet 100G channel.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_block_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_block_lock:

Asserted when the corresponding Ethernet channel completes 66-bit block boundary alignment on all PCS lanes. Each channel has its own block lock signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: link_fault_gen_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
link_fault_gen_en:

Asserted if the IP core includes Clause 66 for unidirectional support. This signal is available if you turn on Enable link fault generation in the parameter editor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_en:

Asserted if the IP core includes Clause 66 for unidirectional support. This signal is available if you turn on Enable link fault generation in the parameter editor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: local_fault_status
spirit:field.spirit:description:
local_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a local fault: the RX PCS detected a problem that prevents it from receiving data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional or Unidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir or lf_unidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: remote_fault_status
spirit:field.spirit:description:
remote_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a remote fault: the remote link partner sent remote fault ordered sets indicating that it is unable to receive data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_force_remote_fault
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_force_remote_fault:

When asserted, this signal indicates the state of the tx_unidir_control register bit 2.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_remote_fault_dis
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_remote_fault_dis:

When asserted, this signal indicates the state of the tx_unidir_control register bit 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pcs_eccstatus
spirit:field.spirit:description:
pcs_eccstatus[1:0]:

Indicates the ECC status. This signal is synchronized to the reg_clk clock domain. 11: An uncorrectable error occurred and the error data appears at the output. 10: A correctable error occurred and the error has been corrected at the output. However, the memory array has not been updated. 01: Not valid. 00: No error Only applicable for TSE_PCS profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: mac_eccstatus
spirit:field.spirit:description:
mac_eccstatus[1:0]:

Indicates the ECC status. This signal is synchronized to the reg_clk clock domain. 11: An uncorrectable error occurred and the error data appears at the output. 10: A correctable error occurred and the error has been corrected at the output. However, the memory array has not been updated. 01: Not valid. 00: No error. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_10
spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_10:

10 Mbps selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to indicate that the MAC function is connected to a 10-Mbps PHY device. When set to 0, the MAC function is set to operate in 100-Mbps or gigabit mode. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED or ENA_10 bit in the command_config register is set to 1. The ENA_10 bit has a higher priority than this signal. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_1000
spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_1000:

Gigabit mode selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to set the MAC function to operate in gigabit. When set to 0, the MAC is set to operate in 10/100 Mbps. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED bit in the command_config register is set to 1. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ena_10
spirit:field.spirit:description:
ena_10:

10 Mbps enable. This signal is set to 1 to indicate that the PHY interface should operate at 10 Mbps. Valid only when the eth_mode signal is set to 0. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: eth_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
eth_mode:

Ethernet mode. This signal is set to 1 when the MAC function is configured to operate at 1000 Mbps; set to 0 when it is configured to operate at 10/100 Mbps. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: load_recipe_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
load_recipe_err:

Load Recipe Error Status.This bit reports the error status of load PMA recipe at power on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cal_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
cal_err:

Calibration Error Status.This bit reports the error status of ical/pcal at power on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_lanes_stable
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Tx_lanes_stable:

Asserted when physical TX lanes are stable and ready to transmit data for the corresponding Ethernet port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_pcs_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Rx_pcs_ready:

Asserted when the RX lanes of the corresponding Ethernet port are fully aligned and ready to receive data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_pll_locked
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Tx_pll_locked:

Tx Ethernet port pll lock

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_ehip0_tx_pll_locked
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip0_tx_pll_locked:

PTP channels Tx_pll_locked (o_ehip{0..NUM_PORT/2}_tx_pll_locked, applicable only in E-tile.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_ehip1_tx_pll_locked
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip1_tx_pll_locked:

PTP channels Tx_pll_locked (o_ehip{0..NUM_PORT/2}_tx_pll_locked, applicable only in E-tile.

spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity Error on received packet

Asserted when the RX lanes of the corresponding Ethernet port are fully aligned and ready to receive data.

Tx_pll_locked:

spirit:field.spirit:name: parity_error
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity Error on received packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: local_fault_status_direct
spirit:field.spirit:description:
local_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a local fault: the RX PCS detected a problem that prevents it from receiving data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional or Unidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir or lf_unidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: remote_fault_status_direct
spirit:field.spirit:description:
remote_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a remote fault: the remote link partner sent remote fault ordered sets indicating that it is unable to receive data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rsvd
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reserved

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_hssi_eth_port3_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: HSSI Ethernet port3 Status (Depends on NUM_PORTS parameter, read returns reserved value 0 if port does not exist)

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_ehip_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip_ready:

The Ethernet channel deasserts this signal in response to an i_csr_rst_n or i_tx_rst_n reset, or either of the corresponding soft resets. After the reset process completes, the channel reasserts this signal to indicate that the Hard IP for Ethernet block has completed initialization and is ready to interoperate with the main Intel Stratix 10 die. While the o_ehip_ready signal is low, the channel's datapath is not ready for data on the client interface nor ready for register accesses on the Ethernet reconfiguration interface.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_rx_hi_ber
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_rx_hi_ber:

Asserted to indicate the RX PCS of the corresponding Ethernet channel is in a HI BER state according to Figure 82-15 in the IEEE 802.3- 2015 Standard. The IP core uses this signal in autonegotiation and link training.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_cdr_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_cdr_lock:

Indicates that the recovered clocks are locked to data. The o_clk_rec_div64[n] and o_clk_rec_div66[n] clocks are reliable only after o_cdr_lock[n] is asserted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_am_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_am_lock:

Asserted when the RX PCS completes detection of alignment markers and deskew of the virtual PCS lanes in the corresponding Ethernet 100G channel.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_block_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_block_lock:

Asserted when the corresponding Ethernet channel completes 66-bit block boundary alignment on all PCS lanes. Each channel has its own block lock signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: link_fault_gen_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
link_fault_gen_en:

Asserted if the IP core includes Clause 66 for unidirectional support. This signal is available if you turn on Enable link fault generation in the parameter editor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_en:

Asserted if the IP core includes Clause 66 for unidirectional support. This signal is available if you turn on Enable link fault generation in the parameter editor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: local_fault_status
spirit:field.spirit:description:
local_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a local fault: the RX PCS detected a problem that prevents it from receiving data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional or Unidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir or lf_unidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: remote_fault_status
spirit:field.spirit:description:
remote_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a remote fault: the remote link partner sent remote fault ordered sets indicating that it is unable to receive data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_force_remote_fault
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_force_remote_fault:

When asserted, this signal indicates the state of the tx_unidir_control register bit 2.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_remote_fault_dis
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_remote_fault_dis:

When asserted, this signal indicates the state of the tx_unidir_control register bit 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pcs_eccstatus
spirit:field.spirit:description:
pcs_eccstatus[1:0]:

Indicates the ECC status. This signal is synchronized to the reg_clk clock domain. 11: An uncorrectable error occurred and the error data appears at the output. 10: A correctable error occurred and the error has been corrected at the output. However, the memory array has not been updated. 01: Not valid. 00: No error Only applicable for TSE_PCS profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: mac_eccstatus
spirit:field.spirit:description:
mac_eccstatus[1:0]:

Indicates the ECC status. This signal is synchronized to the reg_clk clock domain. 11: An uncorrectable error occurred and the error data appears at the output. 10: A correctable error occurred and the error has been corrected at the output. However, the memory array has not been updated. 01: Not valid. 00: No error. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_10
spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_10:

10 Mbps selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to indicate that the MAC function is connected to a 10-Mbps PHY device. When set to 0, the MAC function is set to operate in 100-Mbps or gigabit mode. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED or ENA_10 bit in the command_config register is set to 1. The ENA_10 bit has a higher priority than this signal. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_1000
spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_1000:

Gigabit mode selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to set the MAC function to operate in gigabit. When set to 0, the MAC is set to operate in 10/100 Mbps. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED bit in the command_config register is set to 1. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ena_10
spirit:field.spirit:description:
ena_10:

10 Mbps enable. This signal is set to 1 to indicate that the PHY interface should operate at 10 Mbps. Valid only when the eth_mode signal is set to 0. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: eth_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
eth_mode:

Ethernet mode. This signal is set to 1 when the MAC function is configured to operate at 1000 Mbps; set to 0 when it is configured to operate at 10/100 Mbps. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: load_recipe_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
load_recipe_err:

Load Recipe Error Status.This bit reports the error status of load PMA recipe at power on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cal_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
cal_err:

Calibration Error Status.This bit reports the error status of ical/pcal at power on.

Tx_lanes_stable:

Asserted when physical TX lanes are stable and ready to transmit data for the corresponding Ethernet port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_ehip_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip_ready:

The Ethernet channel deasserts this signal in response to an i_csr_rst_n or i_tx_rst_n reset, or either of the corresponding soft resets. After the reset process completes, the channel reasserts this signal to indicate that the Hard IP for Ethernet block has completed initialization and is ready to interoperate with the main Intel Stratix 10 die. While the o_ehip_ready signal is low, the channel's datapath is not ready for data on the client interface nor ready for register accesses on the Ethernet reconfiguration interface.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_rx_hi_ber
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_rx_hi_ber:

Asserted to indicate the RX PCS of the corresponding Ethernet channel is in a HI BER state according to Figure 82-15 in the IEEE 802.3- 2015 Standard. The IP core uses this signal in autonegotiation and link training.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_cdr_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_cdr_lock:

Indicates that the recovered clocks are locked to data. The o_clk_rec_div64[n] and o_clk_rec_div66[n] clocks are reliable only after o_cdr_lock[n] is asserted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_am_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_am_lock:

Asserted when the RX PCS completes detection of alignment markers and deskew of the virtual PCS lanes in the corresponding Ethernet 100G channel.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_block_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_block_lock:

Asserted when the corresponding Ethernet channel completes 66-bit block boundary alignment on all PCS lanes. Each channel has its own block lock signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: link_fault_gen_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
link_fault_gen_en:

Asserted if the IP core includes Clause 66 for unidirectional support. This signal is available if you turn on Enable link fault generation in the parameter editor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_en:

Asserted if the IP core includes Clause 66 for unidirectional support. This signal is available if you turn on Enable link fault generation in the parameter editor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: local_fault_status
spirit:field.spirit:description:
local_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a local fault: the RX PCS detected a problem that prevents it from receiving data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional or Unidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir or lf_unidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: remote_fault_status
spirit:field.spirit:description:
remote_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a remote fault: the remote link partner sent remote fault ordered sets indicating that it is unable to receive data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_force_remote_fault
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_force_remote_fault:

When asserted, this signal indicates the state of the tx_unidir_control register bit 2.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_remote_fault_dis
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_remote_fault_dis:

When asserted, this signal indicates the state of the tx_unidir_control register bit 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pcs_eccstatus
spirit:field.spirit:description:
pcs_eccstatus[1:0]:

Indicates the ECC status. This signal is synchronized to the reg_clk clock domain. 11: An uncorrectable error occurred and the error data appears at the output. 10: A correctable error occurred and the error has been corrected at the output. However, the memory array has not been updated. 01: Not valid. 00: No error Only applicable for TSE_PCS profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: mac_eccstatus
spirit:field.spirit:description:
mac_eccstatus[1:0]:

Indicates the ECC status. This signal is synchronized to the reg_clk clock domain. 11: An uncorrectable error occurred and the error data appears at the output. 10: A correctable error occurred and the error has been corrected at the output. However, the memory array has not been updated. 01: Not valid. 00: No error. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_10
spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_10:

10 Mbps selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to indicate that the MAC function is connected to a 10-Mbps PHY device. When set to 0, the MAC function is set to operate in 100-Mbps or gigabit mode. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED or ENA_10 bit in the command_config register is set to 1. The ENA_10 bit has a higher priority than this signal. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_1000
spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_1000:

Gigabit mode selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to set the MAC function to operate in gigabit. When set to 0, the MAC is set to operate in 10/100 Mbps. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED bit in the command_config register is set to 1. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ena_10
spirit:field.spirit:description:
ena_10:

10 Mbps enable. This signal is set to 1 to indicate that the PHY interface should operate at 10 Mbps. Valid only when the eth_mode signal is set to 0. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: eth_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
eth_mode:

Ethernet mode. This signal is set to 1 when the MAC function is configured to operate at 1000 Mbps; set to 0 when it is configured to operate at 10/100 Mbps. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: load_recipe_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
load_recipe_err:

Load Recipe Error Status.This bit reports the error status of load PMA recipe at power on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cal_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
cal_err:

Calibration Error Status.This bit reports the error status of ical/pcal at power on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_lanes_stable
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Tx_lanes_stable:

Asserted when physical TX lanes are stable and ready to transmit data for the corresponding Ethernet port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_pcs_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Rx_pcs_ready:

Asserted when the RX lanes of the corresponding Ethernet port are fully aligned and ready to receive data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_pll_locked
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Tx_pll_locked:

Tx Ethernet port pll lock

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_ehip2_tx_pll_locked
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip2_tx_pll_locked:

PTP channels Tx_pll_locked (o_ehip{0..NUM_PORT/2}_tx_pll_locked, applicable only in E-tile.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_ehip3_tx_pll_locked
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip3_tx_pll_locked:

PTP channels Tx_pll_locked (o_ehip{0..NUM_PORT/2}_tx_pll_locked, applicable only in E-tile.

spirit:field.spirit:name: parity_error
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity Error on received packet

spirit:field.spirit:description:
local_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a local fault: the RX PCS detected a problem that prevents it from receiving data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional or Unidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir or lf_unidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: remote_fault_status_direct
spirit:field.spirit:description:
remote_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a remote fault: the remote link partner sent remote fault ordered sets indicating that it is unable to receive data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rsvd
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reserved

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_hssi_eth_port7_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: HSSI Ethernet port7 Status (Depends on NUM_PORTS parameter, read returns reserved value 0 if port does not exist)

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a local fault: the RX PCS detected a problem that prevents it from receiving data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional or Unidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir or lf_unidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: remote_fault_status
spirit:field.spirit:description:
remote_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a remote fault: the remote link partner sent remote fault ordered sets indicating that it is unable to receive data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_force_remote_fault
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_force_remote_fault:

When asserted, this signal indicates the state of the tx_unidir_control register bit 2.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_remote_fault_dis
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_remote_fault_dis:

When asserted, this signal indicates the state of the tx_unidir_control register bit 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pcs_eccstatus
spirit:field.spirit:description:
pcs_eccstatus[1:0]:

Indicates the ECC status. This signal is synchronized to the reg_clk clock domain. 11: An uncorrectable error occurred and the error data appears at the output. 10: A correctable error occurred and the error has been corrected at the output. However, the memory array has not been updated. 01: Not valid. 00: No error Only applicable for TSE_PCS profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: mac_eccstatus
spirit:field.spirit:description:
mac_eccstatus[1:0]:

Indicates the ECC status. This signal is synchronized to the reg_clk clock domain. 11: An uncorrectable error occurred and the error data appears at the output. 10: A correctable error occurred and the error has been corrected at the output. However, the memory array has not been updated. 01: Not valid. 00: No error. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_10
spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_10:

10 Mbps selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to indicate that the MAC function is connected to a 10-Mbps PHY device. When set to 0, the MAC function is set to operate in 100-Mbps or gigabit mode. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED or ENA_10 bit in the command_config register is set to 1. The ENA_10 bit has a higher priority than this signal. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_1000
spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_1000:

Gigabit mode selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to set the MAC function to operate in gigabit. When set to 0, the MAC is set to operate in 10/100 Mbps. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED bit in the command_config register is set to 1. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ena_10
spirit:field.spirit:description:
ena_10:

10 Mbps enable. This signal is set to 1 to indicate that the PHY interface should operate at 10 Mbps. Valid only when the eth_mode signal is set to 0. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: eth_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
eth_mode:

Ethernet mode. This signal is set to 1 when the MAC function is configured to operate at 1000 Mbps; set to 0 when it is configured to operate at 10/100 Mbps. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: load_recipe_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
load_recipe_err:

Load Recipe Error Status.This bit reports the error status of load PMA recipe at power on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cal_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
cal_err:

Calibration Error Status.This bit reports the error status of ical/pcal at power on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_lanes_stable
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Tx_lanes_stable:

Asserted when physical TX lanes are stable and ready to transmit data for the corresponding Ethernet port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_pcs_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Rx_pcs_ready:

Asserted when the RX lanes of the corresponding Ethernet port are fully aligned and ready to receive data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_pll_locked
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Tx_pll_locked:

Tx Ethernet port pll lock

o_ehip4_tx_pll_locked:

PTP channels Tx_pll_locked (o_ehip{0..NUM_PORT/2}_tx_pll_locked, applicable only in E-tile.

spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip5_tx_pll_locked:

This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional or Unidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir or lf_unidir.

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a remote fault: the remote link partner sent remote fault ordered sets indicating that it is unable to receive data. spirit:field.spirit:description: Reserved

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_hssi_eth_port10_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: HSSI Ethernet port10 Status (Depends on NUM_PORTS parameter, read returns reserved value 0 if port does not exist)

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_ehip_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip_ready:

The Ethernet channel deasserts this signal in response to an i_csr_rst_n or i_tx_rst_n reset, or either of the corresponding soft resets. After the reset process completes, the channel reasserts this signal to indicate that the Hard IP for Ethernet block has completed initialization and is ready to interoperate with the main Intel Stratix 10 die. While the o_ehip_ready signal is low, the channel's datapath is not ready for data on the client interface nor ready for register accesses on the Ethernet reconfiguration interface.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_rx_hi_ber
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_rx_hi_ber:

Asserted to indicate the RX PCS of the corresponding Ethernet channel is in a HI BER state according to Figure 82-15 in the IEEE 802.3- 2015 Standard. The IP core uses this signal in autonegotiation and link training.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_cdr_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_cdr_lock:

Indicates that the recovered clocks are locked to data. The o_clk_rec_div64[n] and o_clk_rec_div66[n] clocks are reliable only after o_cdr_lock[n] is asserted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_am_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_am_lock:

Asserted when the RX PCS completes detection of alignment markers and deskew of the virtual PCS lanes in the corresponding Ethernet 100G channel.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_block_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_block_lock:

Asserted when the corresponding Ethernet channel completes 66-bit block boundary alignment on all PCS lanes. Each channel has its own block lock signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: link_fault_gen_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
link_fault_gen_en:

Asserted if the IP core includes Clause 66 for unidirectional support. This signal is available if you turn on Enable link fault generation in the parameter editor.

spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_10:

10 Mbps selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to indicate that the MAC function is connected to a 10-Mbps PHY device. When set to 0, the MAC function is set to operate in 100-Mbps or gigabit mode. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED or ENA_10 bit in the command_config register is set to 1. The ENA_10 bit has a higher priority than this signal. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_1000
spirit:field.spirit:description:
set_1000:

Gigabit mode selection. Can be driven to 1 by an external device, for example a PHY device, to set the MAC function to operate in gigabit. When set to 0, the MAC is set to operate in 10/100 Mbps. This signal is ignored when the ETH_SPEED bit in the command_config register is set to 1. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ena_10
spirit:field.spirit:description:
ena_10:

10 Mbps enable. This signal is set to 1 to indicate that the PHY interface should operate at 10 Mbps. Valid only when the eth_mode signal is set to 0. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: eth_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
eth_mode:

Ethernet mode. This signal is set to 1 when the MAC function is configured to operate at 1000 Mbps; set to 0 when it is configured to operate at 10/100 Mbps. Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: load_recipe_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
load_recipe_err:

Load Recipe Error Status.This bit reports the error status of load PMA recipe at power on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cal_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
cal_err:

Calibration Error Status.This bit reports the error status of ical/pcal at power on.

spirit:field.spirit:description:
Tx_lanes_stable:

Asserted when physical TX lanes are stable and ready to transmit data for the corresponding Ethernet port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_pcs_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Rx_pcs_ready:

Asserted when the RX lanes of the corresponding Ethernet port are fully aligned and ready to receive data.

spirit:field.spirit:description:
Tx_pll_locked:

Tx Ethernet port pll lock

PTP channels Tx_pll_locked (o_ehip{0..NUM_PORT/2}_tx_pll_locked, applicable only in E-tile.

spirit:field.spirit:name: parity_error
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity Error on received packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: local_fault_status_direct
spirit:field.spirit:description:
local_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a local fault: the RX PCS detected a problem that prevents it from receiving data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional or Unidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir or lf_unidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: remote_fault_status_direct
spirit:field.spirit:description:
remote_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a remote fault: the remote link partner sent remote fault ordered sets indicating that it is unable to receive data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rsvd
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reserved

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_hssi_eth_port13_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: HSSI Ethernet port13 Status (Depends on NUM_PORTS parameter, read returns reserved value 0 if port does not exist)

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_ehip_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_ehip_ready:

The Ethernet channel deasserts this signal in response to an i_csr_rst_n or i_tx_rst_n reset, or either of the corresponding soft resets. After the reset process completes, the channel reasserts this signal to indicate that the Hard IP for Ethernet block has completed initialization and is ready to interoperate with the main Intel Stratix 10 die. While the o_ehip_ready signal is low, the channel's datapath is not ready for data on the client interface nor ready for register accesses on the Ethernet reconfiguration interface.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_rx_hi_ber
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_rx_hi_ber:

Asserted to indicate the RX PCS of the corresponding Ethernet channel is in a HI BER state according to Figure 82-15 in the IEEE 802.3- 2015 Standard. The IP core uses this signal in autonegotiation and link training.

spirit:field.spirit:name: o_cdr_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
o_cdr_lock:

Indicates that the recovered clocks are locked to data. The o_clk_rec_div64[n] and o_clk_rec_div66[n] clocks are reliable only after o_cdr_lock[n] is asserted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_am_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_am_lock:

Asserted when the RX PCS completes detection of alignment markers and deskew of the virtual PCS lanes in the corresponding Ethernet 100G channel.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_block_lock
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx_block_lock:

Asserted when the corresponding Ethernet channel completes 66-bit block boundary alignment on all PCS lanes. Each channel has its own block lock signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: link_fault_gen_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
link_fault_gen_en:

Asserted if the IP core includes Clause 66 for unidirectional support. This signal is available if you turn on Enable link fault generation in the parameter editor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: unidirectional_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_en:

Asserted if the IP core includes Clause 66 for unidirectional support. This signal is available if you turn on Enable link fault generation in the parameter editor.

unidirectional_force_remote_fault:

spirit:field.spirit:description:
unidirectional_remote_fault_dis:

When asserted, this signal indicates the state of the tx_unidir_control register bit 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pcs_eccstatus
spirit:field.spirit:description:
pcs_eccstatus[1:0]:

Indicates the ECC status. This signal is synchronized to the reg_clk clock domain. 11: An uncorrectable error occurred and the error data appears at the output. 10: A correctable error occurred and the error has been corrected at the output. However, the memory array has not been updated. 01: Not valid. 00: No error Only applicable for TSE_PCS profile. Reserved for other profiles.

spirit:field.spirit:description:
Rx_pcs_ready:

Asserted when the RX lanes of the corresponding Ethernet port are fully aligned and ready to receive data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: parity_error
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity Error on received packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: local_fault_status_direct
spirit:field.spirit:description:
local_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a local fault: the RX PCS detected a problem that prevents it from receiving data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional or Unidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir or lf_unidir.

spirit:field.spirit:name: remote_fault_status_direct
spirit:field.spirit:description:
remote_fault_status:

Asserted when the RX MAC of the corresponding Ethernet channel detects a remote fault: the remote link partner sent remote fault ordered sets indicating that it is unable to receive data. This signal is functional only if you set the Choose Link Fault generation option parameter to the value of Bidirectional in the parameter editor or if you overwrite the parameter editor parameter by setting the link_fault_mode RTL parameter to the value of lf_bidir.

spirit:register.spirit:name: sscsrif_hssi_tse_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: HSSI TSE Control (Only applicable for TSE_MAC profile, Reserved for other profiles)

spirit:field.spirit:name: Magic_wakeup
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Magic_wakeup:

If the MAC function is in the power-down state, the MAC function asserts this signal to indicate that a magic packet has been detected and the node is requested to restore its normal frame reception mode. This signal is present only if the Enable magic packet detection option is turned on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Magic_sleep_n
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Magic_sleep_n:

Assert this active-low signal to put the node into a power-down state. If magic packets are supported (the MAGIC_ENA bit in the command_config register is set to 1), the receiver logic stops writing data to the receive FIFO buffer and the magic packet detection logic is enabled. Setting this signal to 1 restores the normal frame reception mode. This signal is present only if the Enable magic packet detection option is turned on.
